intro: Pseudobombax subandinum, commonly known as the Andean silk tree, is a deciduous tree native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, ovate leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. It produces woody pods containing seeds with tufts of hair, which aid in wind dispersal. Pseudobombax subandinum is often found in dry to semi-arid habitats and is valued for its ornamental qualities.
